tool.name: Differntially methylated positions Finder
tool.description: Identify CpGs where methylation is associated with a continuous or categorical phenotype.
tool.help:
**What it does**
This function tests each genomic position for association between methylation and a phenotype. Continuous phenotypes are tested with linear regression, while an F-test is used for categorical phenotypes.
Variance shrinkage (shrinkVar=TRUE) is recommended when sample sizes are small(less than 10). The sample variances are squeezed by computing empirical Bayes posterior means using the limma package.
This is only for Illumina 450k Arrays.
**Input** :
dat A MethylSet or a matrix.
pheno The phenotype to be tested for association with methylation.
type Is the phenotype ’‘continuous’ or ‘categorical’ (Currently works only for categorical)
qCutoff DMPs with an FDR q-value greater than this will not be returned.
shrinkVar Should variance shrinkage be used? See details.
NOTE: Make sure the RGset is normalized, otherwise the result wouldn't make too much sense.
**Output**:
A table with one row per CpG.
